episode_title: 217 - The One Where Eddie Moves In
note: [Scene: Joey’s new apartment. Everyone but Chandler is there. Joey has decorated the place with tons of tacky stuff.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Huh? So whaddya think? Casa de Joey. Huh? I decorated it myself.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Get out.

content.speaker: All
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [looking at some kind of glass sculpture thing] Wow Joey, this is, uhh…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Art.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Art it is.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [looking at a glass table with a panther shaped base] Look, check this out. Is it a coffee table, is it a panther? There’s no need to decide.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [holding a pillow made out of 4 inch red fur] Hey, nice pillow. So now tell me, is this genuine Muppet skin?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [looking at a water sculpture that looks like a window with rain running down it] Hey, excellent, excellent water-table thing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks, yeah. I love this but ya know what, it makes me wanna pee.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, well me too, yeah. I think that’s the challenge.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, how come, uhh, Chandler didn’t come?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well uh, it’s cause he had a thing with, wi-, with the thing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Right, I go-, I got it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So why don’t ya show us the rest of your casa?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Uh, oh, OH, the best part, c’mon. [leads them to the bathroom, gestures towards toilet, everyone stares, uncomprehending] Heh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, nice toilet.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No no no, behind it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wha-, you have a phone in here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s right, I have a phone in here .

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, promise me something.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Never call me from that phone.

content.description: Central Perk. Monica, Chandler, and Ross are seated. Rachel is walking over with coffee and a piece of pie.

content.text: [Someone bumps into Rachel and she drops the pie in a guy’s hood that’s seated at the table. She improvises by using the plate as a saucer for the coffee.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, here we go. Honey, I’m sorry, they were all out of apple pie, someone just got the last piece.
[Phoebe enters]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God. You are not gonna believe this. I have just been discovered.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Now wait a minute, I claimed you in the name of France four years ago.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Anyway, OK, now promise you won’t like, freak out and say how great this is until I’m done, OK.

content.speaker: All
content.text: OK.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK. I just met this producer of this like, teeny record company, who said that I have a very fresh, offbeat sound and she wants to do a demo of Smelly Cat .

content.speaker: All
content.text: [congradulating her and celebrating]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I told you not to do that yet. And, she wants to do a video.

content.speaker: All
content.text: [celebrating more]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m not done yet, OK. God. OK, if that goes well, they may even want to make an album.
[everyone is quiet, unsure if she’s done or not]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m done now.

content.speaker: All
content.text: [celebrating]
[the guy with the pie in his hood get up to leave]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God. Ross, OK, if you care about me at all, you will get the pie out of the man’s hood.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Get the what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pie in the hood, pie in the hood. Go.
[Ross goes over behind the guy and grabs the pie out of his hood as he leaves]

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: What’re you doing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry, my pie was, was in your hood. Now I just have to get the coffee out of that guy’s pants and I’ll be back in the hospital by 7. [swats at an imaginary insect by his head, guy leaves promptly]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica is outside the bathroom yelling at Ross who’s in the bathroom.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Damnit Ross, get your butt out of the bathroom.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Calm down, I’m blow drying.
[Rachel enters with laundry and starts folding]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Blow drying what, you have no hair.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s goin’ on?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Your boyfriend has been in there for over an hour. I can’t believe it, it’s like I’m living with him again. He’s here when I go to sleep, he’s here when I wake up, he’s here when I want to use the shower, ughh. It’s like I’m sixteen all over again .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, you’re not sixteen, you’re both adults now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: GET OUT YOU DUFUS!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Or ya know, he’s rubber and you’re glue.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [comes out] All yours.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I hope you cleaned your hair out of the drain.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [in a childish voice] I hope you cleaned your hair out of the drain.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Shut up.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [childish voice] Shut up.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Cut it out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [childish voice] Mi-mi-mii.
[Monica goes in the bathroom]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [sarcastically] I’ve never wanted you more.

content.description: Chandler’s apartment. Chandler is sitting on the bar wearing huge dog-slippers

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, whaddya say boys, should I call him? [squeezes the ear of one of the slippers and it barks] Well, ya know what they say. Ask your slippers a question… you’re going crazy.
[Joey’s apartment, phone rings]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Listen, I’m, I’m sorry I didn’t make it over there today.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, that’s OK. You uh, you had a thing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah well, I hear the place looks great.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahh, forget about it, I’m havin’ a ball. How’s the apartment doin’

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh hey, it’s, it’s terriffic. I mean it’s a regular space… fest.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, well great.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah I just… wanted to call and say hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well OK then. [oven timer goes off behind Chandler] Was that the oven timer?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s right my friend. It’s time for…

content.speaker: Both
content.text: Baywatch!! [both turn on TV’s]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, can you believe they gave Stephanie skin cancer?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I still can’t believe they promoted her to lieutenant.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Naa, you’re just sayin’ that ’cause you’re in love with Yasmine Bleeth.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, how could anyone not be in love with Yasmine Bleeth?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, hey, they’re runnin’

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See, this is the brilliance of the show. I say always keep them running. All the time, running. Run. Run Yasmine, run like the wind.

content.description: Central Perk. Joey is sitting between Monica and Phoebe.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But I thought you wanted to live by yourself.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I did. I thought it’d be great. I figured I’d have like, time alone with my thoughts but, ya know, it turns out I don’t have as many thoughts as you’d think.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Joey, why don’t you talk to Chandler about moving back?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You really think he’d take me? I mean, we had a pretty good talk last night but, when I moved out, I hurt him bad.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I promise you, he would definitely want you back.

content.description: Chandler’s apartment. Chandler is sitting between Rachel and Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m telling you, there’s no way he’s moving back.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But we had one of the greatest talks we ever had last night. I mean it was, it was like when we first started living together.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I know you don’t want to hear this right now but, we’ve seen him in his new place, alright. And he’s happy, he’s, he’s decorated.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look, Chandler, he has moved on, OK, you have to too.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. You’re just gonna have to accept the fact that you’re just friends now, OK, you’re not… rommmates anymore.

content.description: [Scene: Recording studio. Phoebe is getting ready to record Smelly Cat.]

content.speaker: Producer
content.text: OK Phoebe, you ready to try one?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK. [singing] Smelly cat, smell-ly cat, what are they feeding you? Smelly cat [back up singers start singing smelly, smelly, smelly, smelly behind her] Oh woah, oh my God. I mean like, who was that?

content.speaker: Producer
content.text: They’re your backup singers… beind you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OH!! Oh I thought they were just watching me. You know, like at, like at an aquarium, ya know.

content.speaker: Producer
content.text: Alrighty. From the top.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK. [singing] Smelly cat, smell-ly cat, what are they feeding you? Smelly cat [back up singers - smelly, smelly, smelly, really bad smelly cat, it’s not your fault ] OK, sorry. I’m just, I’m just not getting that everyone um, gets how smelly this cat acually is. I just think that maybe if we could talk about this, ’cause I need to feel that you really care about the cat.

content.speaker: Producer
content.text: Honey, uh we, we can talk about this. It’s just that it’s costing about a hundred dollars a minute to be in here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh OK. So, um, the cat stinks but you love it, let’s go.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s apartment. Ross is on the phone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, there is no way he was a velociraptor. No Tony, look at the cranial ridge, OK. If Dino was a velociraptor, he would have eaten the Flintstones. Yeah, yeah. [Monica comes out of her room] Oh, were you takin’ a nap?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I was .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh I-, Oh wait, Tony can you hang on? That’s the other line. [gets the other line] Hello. Oh yeah she’s here but uh, can she call you back? OK thanks. [hangs up the other line] Call Joanna. [back on with Tony] Hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did she leave a number?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Did you see me write one down?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t have her number, butt-munch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, she’ll call back, don’t be such a baby.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m not a baby, you’re the baby.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, you wanna get off my back?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You wanna get out of my face?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait hold on Tony, hold on. [answers second line] Hello. Hi, yeah no, she’s right here. Um hold on. [gets first line] Hi Tony, can I call you back? That’s uh, that’s my sister’s boyfriend.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Give me that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi sweetie, look before I forget, did I leave my diaphram at your place? Hi mom. [she starts throwing oranges at Ross who’s looking pleased with himself]

content.description: Chandler’s apartment. Chandler is sitting on the bar, bouncing a ball against the door. Joey walks in right as he throws the ball and catches it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So uhh, how’s the palace?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You know it’s funny you should mention that ’cause I was thinkin’… what’s with the boxes?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, uhh, actually I uh, have some news.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Hey Chan, is that Joey guy gonna come by and pick up his moose hat or should I just toss it out?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, uh, why don’t you ask him yourself. Joey, this is my new roommate Eddie.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Nice to meet ya.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Likewise. Uh, I’ll take that. [grabs moose hat] It’s what I came for. So, this is new. Where’d you two meet?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: At the uh, supermarket, in the uh, ethnic food section. I helped him pick out a chorizo.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well you know, we got to talking and uh, he said he needed a place and I had a spare room.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, now it’s a spare room?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well yeah, in that it’s not being used and I… have it to spare.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well I uh, got what I came for. [puts on moose hat] I’ll uh, I’ll see you guys.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Jo. When’d you start usin’ mousse in your hair?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: [annoying laugh] Is this guy great or what?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, yeah he is. [leaves]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica, Rachel, and Ross are there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe he has a new roommate. Who is this guy?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, Eddie something. He just met him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’ll never last, he’s just a rebound roommate.
[Pheobe enters]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, check it out, oh check it out. It’s Smelly Cat the video.

content.speaker: All
content.text: [cheer]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Now OK, I haven’t seen it yet so, if you don’t like it, well, so what, none of you ever made a video. [puts the tape in] OK.
[The video is a very dramatic episode with an obviously dubbed voice for Phoebe. Everyone watches in disbeliefe]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I sound amazing. I, I, I’ve never heard myself sing before. I mean, except in my own head. Oh, this is so cool, now I can hear what you hear.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pretty uhm, different huh?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I am sorry but I am incredibly talented.

content.description: Chandler and Eddie’s apartment. Joey stops by. Chandler is reading the paper and Eddie is fixing eggs.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Hi Joey, what’s goin’ on man?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Eddie.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Morning.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Morning. I just uh, came by to pick up my mail. [looks for the mail on the table by the door, it’s not there] Where’s the mail?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh it’s uh, over there on the table.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You don’t keep it over here on this table any more?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, Eddie likes to keep it over there.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Alright, here you go my friend. Eggs a-la Eddie, huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, ooh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Huh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No I just uh, thought you liked your eggs with the bread with the hole in the middle, a-la me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well I do, but uh, Eddie makes them this way and, well they’re pretty darn good.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Well you guys, I’m outta here. See ya pals.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See ya. [Eddie leaves]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So how you two gettin’ along?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I couldn’t be happier.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Great, well, I’m happy for ya. [picks up the orange juice carton and it’s empty] Alright that’s it. He just comes in here, Mr. Jonny Neweggs, with his, his, his movin’ the mail and his, his ’see ya pals’. And now there’s no juice. There’s no juice f or the people who need the juice and want the juice. I need the juice.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There’s another carton right over there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, this isn’t about juice anymore, alright man.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, so what’s it about?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Eggs. Who’s eggs do you like better, his or mine, huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well I like both eggs equally.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh come on. Nobody likes two different kinds of eggs equally. You like one better than the other and I wanna know which.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well what’s the difference? Your eggs aren’t here anymore, are they? You took your eggs and you left. You really expect me to never find new eggs?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Ross and Monica are fighting over the remote.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I wanna watch Entertainment Tonight .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Tough noogies, we’re watching Predators of the Serengetti.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Would you guys stop.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s my TV.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wha-, oh, quit it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bite me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, Monica keeps changin’ the channel.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh that’s great, why don’t you tell mommy on me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Now I’m mommy in this little play? Alright look, I refuse to get sucked into this like, weird little Geller dimension thing OK. So I’m gonna go and take a nice long hot bubble bath because you kids are driving me crazy. [goes in the bathroom]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: OK, what’re we gonna do about this?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I guess we could tape Entertainment Tonight .

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Not that, this, US. Oh my God, Ross, you-re, you’re, it’s jus-, you-, ever sin- you been here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ow, ow, OK. Alright, alright, Mon, Mon, you’ve gone ultrasonic again, alright.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I just can’t stand you being here all the time.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why, why, why can’t you stand me being here? I don’t, I, we’re just, ya know, we’re just havin’ fun.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Fun? Fun, you think this is fun?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, c’mon I mean I though, you know, I thought we’re just foolin’ around. Like when, uh, when we were kids.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, I hated you when we were kids.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You hated me when we were kids?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes. I hated you. I mean I, I, loved you in a ‘you’re my brother so I have to’ kind of way, but basically, yeah, I hated your guts.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why did you hate me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because, you were mean to me and you, you teased me and you always, always got your way.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And that wasn’t fun for you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Duh-huh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can’t believe you hated me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Now I love you. And not just ’cause I have to.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. You’re just gonna have to stop pissing me off.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can do that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Then I won’t have to kill you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So you wanna watch uh, Entertainment Tonight ?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, thanks. You know what?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: If you really want to watch that Serengetti thing, you can.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh… OK. [changes the channel]

content.description: Central Perk. Ross, Rachel, and Monica are hanging out.

content.text: [Phoebe enters]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Listen. You are not going to believe this but, that is not me singing on the video.

content.speaker: All
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, how did you find out?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, OK, the record company sent over this piece of paper for me to sign, saying that it’s OK for someone else to sing for me. That was my first clue.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So what’re you gonna do?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I can’t work with people who would do this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I mean this poor woman.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What woman?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: The voice woman. Ya know, I mean, she has a great voice but she doesn’t have a video.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, Phoebs. But what about you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well I have a video, you have to pay attention. No this, this voice woman, she’s so talented but, according to the producer people, they said she doesn’t have like the right look or something, ya know. I mean, it’s like, she’s like one of those an imals at the pound who like nobody wants ’cause they’re not pretty enough or you know. Like, like some old dog who’s just kind of like stinky and. Huuuuh, oh my God, she’s smelly cat. Oh, oh that song has so many levels.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Eddie, you uh, wanna play some foosball?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: No thanks man, I’m not uh, I’m not really into sports.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [stares in disbeliefe] Yeah o-, OK, alright. [oven timer goes off] Doesn’t matter, time for Baywatch .

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Y-, y-, you like that show?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You don’t like that show?

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: Wha-, n-, no. I mean it’s just a bunch of pretty people runnin’ around on the beach, ya know.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well that’s the brilliance of it. The pretty people… and the running.

content.speaker: Eddie
content.text: I tell ya, I-, I’m gonna go read in my room for a little while.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh o-, OK man.
[Joey’s place. He’s watching Baywatch, lauging. He goes to say something to Chandler in the other chair but no one’s there. He goes to call Chandler but decides not to.]
[Chandler’s. He’s playing foosball by himself.]
[Joey’s. Playing ping pong by himself.]

[All by myself is playing. Chandler is sitting in front of a window while it’s raining outside. We see Joey through a rainy window. The camera zooms out to show it’s just his tabletop water sculpture.]

content.description: [Scene: Central Perk. Phoebe is performing Smelly Cat.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [singing] Smelly cat, smell-ly cat, what are they feeding you? Everybody.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Smelly cat, smell-ly cat, it’s not your fault.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Monica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [sings] They won’t take you to the vet.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [reluctantly sings] You’re obviously not their favorite pet.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: [sings] It may not be a bed of roses.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [sings] And you’re no friend to those with noses.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh, Ross, those are the only lines we have, sorry. OK, you guys, once more.
